skill.name: implementation-review
skill.description: Automatically trigger review agents after task completion. Use when strategic-planner finishes planning tasks (calls plan-consultant) or when main agent completes coding tasks in /implement workflow (calls code-reviewer). Triggers on phrases like "plan complete", "implementation done", "coding finished", "ready for review".
skill.summary: Automatically trigger review agents after task completion in EPIC workflow
skill.author: Emz1998

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected markdown inline code formatting as shell backtick execution. All external_commands findings are false positives. The skill contains only documentation for agent delegation with no actual code execution, network requests, or file system operations.

medium_findings.title: False Positive: Markdown Inline Code Formatting
medium_findings.description: Static analyzer flagged backtick-wrapped text as Ruby/shell backtick execution. These are markdown inline code formatting for agent names like `strategic-planner`, `plan-consultant`, and `code-reviewer`. No shell command execution exists in this skill.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Clear evidence of markdown documentation with inline code formatting for agent names. No executable code, shell commands, or code execution vectors exist in this documentation-only skill file.

content.value_statement: Quality gates in AI workflows often require manual triggering of review agents. This skill automatically detects when planning or coding tasks complete and delegates to appropriate review agents, ensuring consistent code and plan quality without workflow interruption.
actual_capabilities: Detects strategic-planner completion signals and triggers plan-consultant review
Detects implementation completion and triggers code-reviewer agent
Integrates with EPIC workflow phases for automated quality gates
Collects and reports structured review findings back to workflow
Flags critical issues before proceeding to next workflow phase
limitations: Requires compatible review agents (plan-consultant, code-reviewer) to be available
Only works within EPIC workflow structure - standalone use requires workflow integration
Cannot modify code during review - only reports findings
Review quality depends on the configured review agents capabilities

use_cases.title: Enforce Plan Quality Before Implementation
use_cases.description: Project leads use this skill to ensure all implementation plans are reviewed before coding begins. The skill automatically triggers plan-consultant when the strategic-planner finishes, catching feasibility issues and risks early.

use_cases.title: Automate Code Reviews in CI Workflows
use_cases.description: Development teams integrate this skill to automate code review gates. After implementation tasks complete, the skill invokes code-reviewer agent to validate code quality, security, and standards compliance automatically.

use_cases.title: Standardize Review Process Across Projects
use_cases.description: Organizations use this skill to enforce consistent review procedures. The skill ensures every plan and code implementation goes through standardized review checkpoints regardless of team or project.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Review Trigger
prompt_templates.prompt: The strategic-planner has completed the implementation plan. Please review it.
prompt_templates.scenario: When planning phase completes and you need a plan review

prompt_templates.title: Implementation Complete
prompt_templates.prompt: The main agent has finished implementing the feature. The TDD green phase is complete. Please run a code review on the changes.
prompt_templates.scenario: When coding tasks finish and you need code validation

prompt_templates.title: Full Workflow Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the completed implementation including the plan that was approved and the code that was written. Provide findings for both.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need comprehensive review of plan and implementation

prompt_templates.title: Critical Findings Check
prompt_templates.prompt: After the code review, check if any critical issues were found. If the status is BLOCKED, explain what needs to be fixed before proceeding.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need to understand blocking issues from review

best_practices: Configure blocking reviews to prevent low-quality code from reaching production
Use review findings to create actionable tickets for follow-up work
Combine with commit hooks to ensure reviews complete before git operations
anti_patterns: Skipping reviews when under time pressure defeats the quality gate purpose
Ignoring BLOCKED status and proceeding to implementation
Using the skill without configured review agents (plan-consultant, code-reviewer)

faq.question: What agents does this skill delegate to?
faq.answer: This skill delegates to two agents: plan-consultant for plan reviews and code-reviewer for code reviews. Both agents must be configured in your Claude Code environment.

faq.question: How does it detect task completion?
faq.answer: The skill listens for completion signals like 'plan complete', 'implementation done', 'coding finished', or 'ready for review' from the strategic-planner agent or main agent in the EPIC workflow.

faq.question: Can I skip reviews for small changes?
faq.answer: The skill enforces reviews as mandatory quality gates. Skipping reviews is not supported by design to ensure consistent quality across all changes regardless of size.

faq.question: What happens if a review is BLOCKED?
faq.answer: When a review status is BLOCKED, the skill flags the issues and prevents progression to the next EPIC phase. The blocking issues must be resolved before proceeding.

faq.question: Does this skill modify code?
faq.answer: No. The skill only reports review findings. It does not modify code during the review process. This separation ensures clean separation between review and implementation.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my existing workflow?
faq.answer: Place this skill in your .claude/skills directory and ensure the plan-consultant and code-reviewer agents are available. The skill will automatically trigger based on completion keywords in your workflow.
